description: From Middle English laweful, equivalent to law +‎ -ful, conflated with Middle English leful, leeful, leveful (“according to law, lawful, pertaining to law”). See also leveful.

adjectives.description: lawful (comparative more lawful, superlative most lawful)

entries.meaning: (law) Conforming to, or recognised by the laws of society.
examples: Lawful money is always a land asset and can only be issued by an actual land jurisdiction government — not a corporation.

entries.meaning: Operating according to some law or fundamental principle.
(role-playing games) A character having a lawful alignment.
